subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: The Ghost Box, is training required?
author: Fransen, Debbie
full_text:
------_=_NextPart_001_01C92AD2.0FEA51EF
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Will you guys STOP this arguing stuff.
The only man that I can see that I r=
espect is Frank.
He doesn't get into all of this pettiness.
Now, all of you=
 get over yourselves and remember why you started doing this.....
 
CAN'T W=
E ALL JUST GET ALONG !!!!!

________________________________

From: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Jon Maronge
=
Sent: Thursday, October 09, 2008 8:50 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subjec=
t: [EVP-ITC] Re: The Ghost Box, is training required?



obviously steve, y=
ou fail to remember when just a week ago i had to
apologize to you for aski=
ng you a question that i had no idea you and
the other person did not speak=
? i was only interested in the
technology and furthering itc research. but =
i guess that one question
came across too smug.

you said to black bear tha=
t he doesn't know you he dislikes you. I
don't think that is the case at al=
l. i still don't have a problem with
you either. all i ever wanted to do is=
 talk about the research you
were doing.

I now have 2 frank's boxes (the G=
HOSTMAN 3 and FB#33) to do my
research. (btw.. i thanks you a bunch already=
 frank.. so thank you again)

Steve, you come across as an expert is all i =
am saying. that is why i
contacted you. "boxmaster estraordinaire" is it? F=
or you to say "who
is this guy?" and cause problems for a mutual friend is =
absurd. so..
for you and everyone to know a little about me...

oct 22 i tu=
rn 33 years old. I have been interested in the box
technology for a few yea=
rs now. i have been doing paranormal
investigations for 19 years now and to=
ok a 3 year break (which is when
you popped up on the scene.) Now i'm back =
and hitting it hard again
and want to be able to use the best equipment tha=
t money can't buy.

Frank doesn't even pretend to be an expert nor does he =
expect his name
to be mentioned every time an article is published. anyways=
.. i
probably said more than i should have already.

bear... i'm up for tha=
t duel.. sounds fun...lol best one wins a
"certificate of expertification" =
sign by the us president...lol

btw.. one rule bear... no cutting and pasti=
ng clips together to make
one up. haha

--jon

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> , "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:=

>
> 
> I never claimed to be the first on the RS hack, i just posted the 
=
> first files from it. I have no ego and have many friends on here 
> that =
could attest to that, i educate what i have learned along the 
> way and th=
at's all. No recording duels here, nobody cares anyway. 
> What would that =
serve? I only have helped people on here and other 
> boards. 
> 
> -Steve
=
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com=
> , black bear hollow 
> <blackbearhollow@> wrote:

 I've heard

 it.

> > list, but don=
't store them here. I've also heard

eard before,
> > but as always I enjoy listening to everyone's efforts.
> >=
 
> > What I don't like is an attitude and egomania
> > when it comes to th=
is research.
> > 
> > Next I guess you'll challenge me to a recording
> > d=
uel? LOL. Give that ego a rest.
> >

 Hultay" <urkel23@> wrote:
> >

> > > You're right and i'm not here t=
o argue with anyone. You obviously
> > > don't know me, but dislike me. Tha=
t's ok, i like to get along with

orward. I would love to hear 
> some

boxes and compare notes on what 
> we've
> > > been getting. My results are=
 in the files section here.
> > >
> > > -Steve

ahoogroups.com <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> , black bear hollow

So has Frank. Mike too. I could go on

and on other lists who have contributed

efore you showed up on the recording scene.

6:42 PM, Steve Hultay wrote:
